MPU - Memory Protection Unit
mcu » apollo330P

Detailed Description

Purpose: This module provides hardware abstraction layer functions for the Memory Protection Unit (MPU) on Apollo5 devices. It supports memory region configuration, access control, attribute management, and protection settings for secure memory management.

Key Features

  1. Memory Protection: Configure memory regions with access control.
  2. Region Management: Support for multiple memory protection regions.
  3. Access Control: Define read/write/execute permissions for regions.
  4. Fault Protection: NMI and fault protection mechanisms.
  5. Privilege Control: Privileged and unprivileged access control.

Functionality

  • Enable and disable MPU functionality
  • Configure memory protection regions
  • Set up access permissions and attributes
  • Handle privilege and fault protection
  • Manage memory region enable/disable

Usage

  1. Enable MPU using am_hal_mpu_enable()
  2. Configure memory regions with am_hal_mpu_region_configure()
  3. Set up access attributes as needed
  4. Enable/disable specific regions
  5. Handle MPU faults and protection violations

Configuration

  • Memory Regions: Configure memory region boundaries and sizes
  • Access Permissions: Set up read/write/execute permissions
  • Protection Levels: Configure privilege and fault protection
  • Attributes: Set up memory attributes and caching behavior

Function Documentation

◆ am_hal_mpu_attr_configure()

uint32_t am_hal_mpu_attr_configure ( am_hal_mpu_attr_t * psConfig,
uint32_t ui32Cnt )

Configure MPU attributes.

Parameters
psConfig- MPU attibutes
ui32Cnt- Amount of attribute combinations

This function performs the necessary configuration for the MPU attribute described by the psConfig structure, and will configure multiple groups of attributes if the ui32Cnt is greater than 1.

◆ am_hal_mpu_enable()

uint32_t am_hal_mpu_enable ( bool bPrivelegedDefault,
bool bFaultNMIProtect )

Enable the MPU.

Parameters
bPrivelegedDefault- Enable the default priveleged memory map
bFaultNMIProtect- Enable the MPU during fault handlers

This function is a wrapper for the MPU_CTRL register, which controls the global configuration of the MPU. This function can enable the MPU overall, and also controls how fault handlers, NMI service routines, and priveleged-mode execution is handled by the MPU.

Setting bPrivelegedDefault will enable the default memory map for priveleged accesses. If the MPU is enabled with this value set, only priveleged code can execute from the system address map

Setting bFaultNMIProtect leaves the MPU active during the execution of NMI and Hard Fault handlers. Clearing this value will disable the MPU during these procedures.

◆ am_hal_mpu_region_clear()

uint32_t am_hal_mpu_region_clear ( void )

Returns
None.

◆ am_hal_mpu_region_configure()

uint32_t am_hal_mpu_region_configure ( am_hal_mpu_region_config_t * psConfig,
uint32_t ui32Cnt )

Configure MPU regions.

Parameters
psConfig- MPU region configurations
ui32Cnt- Amount of regions to be configured

This function performs the necessary configuration for the MPU region described by the psConfig structure, and will configure multiple regions if the ui32Cnt is greater than 1.

◆ am_hal_mpu_region_disable()

uint32_t am_hal_mpu_region_disable ( uint8_t ui8RegionNumber)

Disable an MPU region.

Parameters
ui8RegionNumber- Index of region to be disabled

Disable the MPU region referred to by ui8RegionNumber.

◆ am_hal_mpu_region_enable()

uint32_t am_hal_mpu_region_enable ( uint8_t ui8RegionNumber)

Enable an MPU region.

Parameters
ui8RegionNumber- Index of region to be enabled

Enable the MPU region referred to by ui8RegionNumber.

Note
This function should only be called after the desired region has already been configured.
